Relief is not enough. Puerto Rico and USVI must rebuild with resilience to better withstand future disasters.
In the 10 weeks since #HurricaneMaria, the Administration’s response has been anemic and inadequate – a national disgrace that betrays all Americans.
Proud to join my colleagues in announcing a long-term, comprehensive plan to help fellow Americans in Puerto Rico & U.S. Virgin Islands recover and rebuild.

I urge everyone to read this new report on the dangerous toys still widely available in stores. It could save you a trip to the ER this holiday season.https://twitter.com/ConnPIRG/status/933032415873961989 …

Toy safety goes beyond physical hazards. Increasingly popular internet-connected toys can become a tool for trolls to target kids – or for trackers to sell their personal info to advertisers. I’m fighting to strengthen laws.
Holiday celebrations can turn tragic in an instant thanks to dangers found in items as simple as balloons and magnets. Understanding the risks now could save a child’s life.
I joined @ConnPIRG at @CTChildrens to highlight this year’s "Trouble in Toyland" report – a must-read on hazardous toys available across America.pic.twitter.com/DKMlfOL920
Every year in America, hundreds of thousands of kids are treated in hospitals for preventable toy-related injuries. Parental vigilance can often make a world of difference.

Powerful alliance across the aisle could be a step toward more effective measures against gun violence.

With the Fix NICS Act we can bolster our background check system, keep guns away from would-be killers, and save lives. Grateful for my colleagues on both sides of the aisle for confronting this crisis with action.

Our bipartisan Fix NICS Act will incentivize states, and hold federal agencies accountable, to build robust reporting systems that can prevent gun sales to people who are a danger to themselves or others - including convicted domestic abusers.

From Sutherland Springs to Charleston to Blacksburg, we’ve seen what can happen when gaps in the National Instant Criminal Background Check System (NICS) let guns fall into the wrong hands. Enough is enough.
Americans have waited long enough for commonsense reforms to curb gun violence. Today, we are taking bipartisan action.

As we continue our fight for passage of SESTA, I am buoyed by the steadfast support from diverse stakeholders committed to giving victims of sex trafficking their day in court, and bringing online sex traffickers to justice.

Momentum is building for our bipartisan bill, due in large part to the growing chorus of voices – including key figures in the technology sector – calling for an end to the shameful, shocking practice of selling children for sex.

This critical step forward in our fight to end online sex trafficking is thanks to the tireless work of advocates, survivors, and a diligent bipartisan coalition of my colleagues.https://twitter.com/MissingKidsCEO/status/928286509173796864 …
The Stop Enabling Sex Traffickers Act - bipartisan legislation I sponsored with @SenRobPortman - was approved by the Senate Commerce Committee this morning.

Gun violence touches communities of all sizes in all states. Curbing this senseless scourge can and should be a bipartisan priority.
We cannot allow ourselves to become desensitized to the gun violence gripping America. We cannot lose hope that action is possible.
Connecticut knows the horror of gun violence all too well. We grieve with the brave souls in Texas enduring unspeakable pain.

“(Elder abuse) takes all forms, yet financial abuse is among most prevalent in 44 states” #EndElderAbuse

Now testifying - Bob Blancato, National Coordinator of The Elder Justice Coalition
"and family caregivers as well as physical neglect by caregivers not attending to the physical needs of a frail older adult." #EndElderAbuse
"Our staffs r seeing more cases in the area of self-neglect, financial abuse by paid and family caregivers..." #EndElderAbuse
Now testifying - Neysa Stallman Guerino, Executive Director, Agency on Aging of South Central Connecticut #EndElderAbuse
“…work w/ Chief State's Attorney needs to be built upon to asst law enfcmt in answering the growing needs of this population” #EndElderAbuse
“…strengthen law enfcmt coordination- a mandate that firms up the relationship between PSE & law enfcmt at the local level…” #EndElderAbuse
“Fed gov can help by cont’d advocating for 'Home' for Adult Protective Services….” #EndElderAbuse
“Protective Services for the Elderly Prgm seeks to help vulnerable elders prevent injury, mantain hlth & preserve rights” #EndElderAbuse
Now testifying Pam Giannini, Director of the Bureau of Aging, Community & Social Work Services #EndElderAbuse
“Despite the growing public awareness (elder abuse) still remains under-reported, under-recognized and under- prosecuted.” #EndElderAbuse
“It can decimate incomes & assets both great and small, fracture families, and cause premature institutionalization.” #EndElderAbuse
"4 out of 5 cases go unreported" #EndElderAbuse
“Annual financial loss by victims is est to be at least $2.9 billion, a 12% increase from $2.6 billion we estimated in 08” #EndElderAbuse
“I’d like to highlight a natl study that we recently rlsd on elder financial abuse…" #EndElderAbuse
Now testifying - Sandra Timmerman, Vice President and Director, MetLife Mature Market Institute #EndElderAbuse
“If today’s hearing helps 1 person in a similar situation, then I will be happy & proud” #EndElderAbuse
"As I testify today I like to think that I am doing so as a survivor." #EndElderAbuse
“I never thought that I would be a victim. I never thought that my own son would turn me into a victim of abuse.” #EndElderAbuse
"My son, has failed me and hurt me in a way that no amount of words or  testimony could describe and do justice." #EndElderAbuse
“He told me that if I wanted my house back I better get a good lawyer. He then began to demand that I pay him $1,000 a month” #EndElderAbuse
“After I was diagnosed w/ cancer for the 2nd time, I returned home 2 CT. When I arrived @ my home, my son refused 2 let me in”#EndElderAbuse
“I signed my estate over to my son, bc I trusted him.” #EndElderAbuse
“My son John told me that he would watch the business, & that my properties/finances were 'in trust' for me” #EndElderAbuse
"This is a story thats much harder in so many ways 4 me to share w u, bc I was victimized at the hands of someone I loved." #EndElderAbuse
